results.title: James Galway Program 3
results.brief_description: Famous flautist, James Galway, introduces Nigel Kennedy, the violin virtuoso, with Peter Pettinger on piano to perform “Notta” by Manuel de Falla, 1st movement of a sonata by Ravel, Gershwin’s “2nd Prelude”, Gershwin’s “1st Prelude” and finally “Alls Blues” by Miles Davis. Rated: G

results.brief_description: In this program James Galway, famous flautist introduces John Lill, the pianist to perform as soloist “The Chaconne” by Bach, “Nocturne in E Minor, Opus 72” by Chopin and the “Finale of the 7th Sonata” by Prokofiev. Rated: G

results.title: James Dean: the rare movies
results.creator_credit: Management Corporation of America, Meridan, Martin Horrell, Mort Abrahams, William Self, Don Medford and Justis Addiss
results.brief_description: These three teleplays, produced in 1953, 1954 and 1955 display James Dean’s mastery of playing the young angst-ridden loner who longs for a better life for himself. “Something for an empty briefcase”: A young drifter and ex-jailbird pines to be a respectable gentleman in life, the type who carries a briefcase to work, instead of a thief. One night he meets a young dancer who displays to him that it is possible to live with passion for life, not just for money. “The unlighted road”: Jeffrey is an ex-army serviceman drifting from small town to small town hoping to find a connection somewhere or with something. One night he is offered a job in a diner but suspects foul play amidst some of the more seedy customers. When Jeffrey falls for a local girl, their future together is threatened by his boss’ dodgy dealings. “I’m a fool”: an older man laments his youthful folly when as a simple farm boy he put on false airs and graces in order to win the attention of the lovely and sophisticated Lucy. Also stars: Natalie Wood. All three short films retain the advertisements from the show’s sponsor inserted at intermission.

results.title: James Dean: the first American teenager
results.creator_credit: Good Times Enterprises, David Puttnam, Sandy Lieberson and Ray Connolly
results.brief_description: This documentary narrated by Stacey Keach attempts to look behind the mask of the shy young tragic screen icon, James Dean. Footage from early television appearances, stills from his life, and clips from his three films are interwoven with interviews with his co-workers. Includes interviews with Sal Mineo, Nicholas Ray, Dennis Hopper, Carroll Baker and Natalie Wood, among others.

results.title: James Brown 1956-1976
results.brief_description: The Godfather of soul music, James Brown, scored his first hit single over 30 years ago, and has continued to reach the charts ever since. His sensational showmanship has excited audiences all over the world, while his athletic energy, together with irresistibly funky music, has made him a hero to three generations. This 100% music video is an historical review of his musical career.

results.title: James Baldwin: the price of the ticket
results.creator_credit: Karen Thorsen, William Miles and Douglas Dempsey
results.brief_description: The life, works and beliefs of the late Black American writer and civil- rights activist, James Baldwin; what it is to be born black, impoverished, gay and gifted in a world that has as yet to understand that “all men are brothers”. In this documentary without narration, Baldwin tells his own story. Using rarely-seen archival footage the film melds intimate interviews and eloquent public speeches with astounding cinema-verite glimpses of James Baldwin. An emotional portrait, a social critique and a passionate plea for human equality.

results.title: James and the giant peach
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions, Allied Filmmakers, Denise Di Novi, Tim Burton and Henry Selick
results.brief_description: Based on Roald Dahl’s classic story, your whole family will delight in Disney’s juicy fantasy adventure, a wildly imaginative tale about a young boy who journeys to wondrous New York City to fulfill a dream. This is a magical odyssey soaring with amazing animation and original music. Cast includes Joanna Lumley, Simon Callow, Richard Dreyfuss, Pete Postlethwaite. Jane Leeves, Paul Terry, Miriam Margolyes, Susan Sarandon, David Thewlis.

results.title: Jamboree for friendship
results.brief_description: Boy Scouts from one hundred countries take part in the varied activities at the Twelfth Boy Scout Jamboree in Idaho, summer 1967. Youths swap talk and ideas, show each other crafts, national dances and customs, attend religious services, take part in a rodeo and a spectacular night campfire - making friends from around the world.

results.title: Jamboree
results.creator_credit: Owen Brothers Animated Films and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The story begins with preparations near Melbourne for the Pacific Jamboree, which 10,500 scouts, from Pacific as well as European countries, attended. The film also includes performances of different national dances.
